prerequisites: Prerequisite: Biology 125 and Biology 126, and one upper-level course in ecology (Biology 221, 321 or 352) or plant biology (Biology 236)or instructor permission
summary: This course will explore the ecology of the ecosystems and organisms of Minnesota--including lakes and rivers, grasslands, and deciduous and boreal forest--through the reading and analysis of the primary literature and independent field research projects. Students will gain skills in species identification, experimental design, scientific writing and presentation. In addition to scheduled class time, this course includes two weekend field trips.
title: Seminar: Natural History of Minnesota
